page.title: 17...INDUSTRY.
page.content: The major part of the block is covered by non-industrial land and premises. However, the section immediately north of the M6 Motorway is quite densely industrialised. The largest single area is occupied by Fort Dunlop and its associated premises, devoted to the production of rubber-based goods.In particular tyres for motor vehicles are made here. Other premises are mainly occupied by companies contributing metal parts to the motor trade. Small, independent metal manufacturers occupy units in a group of manufacturing premises. There is also evidence of industrial capacity which is surplus to current needs with a number of vacant medium-sized units. Some of these are now being used as warehouses for Boots the Chemist.
